fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action taken by the server or proxy.

fields.name: app
fields.comment: The application detected or hosted by the server/site such as wordpress, splunk, or facebook.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The destination of the network traffic (the remote host). You can alias this from more specific fields, such as dest_host, dest_ip, or dest_name.

fields.name: dest_port
fields.comment: The destination port of the web traffic.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The source of the network traffic (the client requesting the connection).

fields.name: status
fields.comment: The HTTP response code indicating the status of the proxy request.

fields.name: uri_path
fields.comment: The path of the resource served by the webserver or proxy.

fields.name: url
fields.comment: The URL of the requested HTTP resource.

fields.name: url_length
fields.comment: The length of the URL.

fields.name: category
fields.comment: The category of traffic, such as may be provided by a proxy server.

fields.name: bytes
fields.comment: The total number of bytes transferred (bytes_in + bytes_out).

fields.name: bytes_in
fields.comment: The number of inbound bytes transferred.

fields.name: bytes_out
fields.comment: The number of outbound bytes transferred.

fields.name: http_user_agent
fields.comment: The user agent used in the request.

fields.name: http_user_agent_length
fields.comment: The length of the user agent used in the request.

fields.name: cached
fields.comment: Indicates whether the event data is cached or not.

fields.name: duration
fields.comment: The time taken by the proxy event, in milliseconds.

fields.name: http_content_type
fields.comment: The content-type of the requested HTTP resource.

fields.name: http_content_type
fields.comment: The HTTP method used in the request.

fields.name: response_time
fields.comment: The amount of time it took to receive a response, if applicable, in milliseconds.

fields.name: uri_query
fields.comment: The path of the resource requested by the client.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user that requested the HTTP resource.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product of the proxy server, such as Squid Proxy Server. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: cookie
fields.comment: The cookie file recorded in the event.

fields.name: http_referrer
fields.comment: The HTTP referrer used in the request. The W3C specification and many implementations misspell this as http_referer. Use a FIELDALIAS to handle both key names.

fields.name: site
fields.comment: The virtual site which services the request, if applicable.
